17:14 <tmortagne> [WARN] starting the maven/git release  
17:14 <Kebir> has joined #xwiki  
17:16 <vmassol> cool  
17:16 <tmortagne> will probably do the paperwork tomorrow  
17:17 <tmortagne> (on a1-1 btw)  
17:17 <vmassol> playing the guinea pig, cool :)  
17:17 <zenzla2> has joined #xwiki  
17:18 <tmortagne> lest say that it seems to work pretty well on jekins and if i'm lucky it means the release is going to be much faster  
17:19 <zenzla> has quit  
17:20 <tmortagne> for now it's already better since I did not had the tty issue (http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleasePlans/ReleasePlanHelp#HBuildtherelease)  
17:20 <tmortagne> which I always did on a1  
17:20 <vmassol> ok cool  
17:26 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
17:26 <gdelhumeau> hi guys  
17:26 <gdelhumeau> I still have a problem with JIRA  
17:26 <gdelhumeau> I can't assign a task to me  
17:26 <gdelhumeau> I can't close an issue, etc...  
17:26 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: ok I can check  
17:26 <vmassol> what's your username?  
17:26 <gdelhumeau> It's like I have lost some rights  
17:26 <gdelhumeau> gdelhumeau: :)  
17:26 <cjd> welcome to committership, it's less glamorous than you may have thought  
17:27 <vmassol> you're a jira administrator :)  
17:27 <vmassol> "I can't close an issue": on what projecT?  
17:28 <gdelhumeau> xwiki-platform  
17:30 <vmassol> jira is broken for me, admin screens are failing, checking with infra. BTW on such issues you should contact the infra team  
17:34 <vmassol> going to restar jira  
17:34 <vmassol> \*restart  
17:36 <gdelhumeau> still failing for me  
17:39 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: normal, nothing was changed  
17:44 <vmassol> has quit

18:01 <UCC> has quit  
18:01 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: I'm currently releasing so please avoid commit stuff  
18:05 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: are you done with XWIKI-7970 ?  
18:05 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: yes  
18:06 <gdelhumeau> sorry for disturbing the release...  
18:06 <tmortagne> close it for 5.4M1 then and I will continue with platform  
18:06 <tmortagne> commons and rendering are done  
18:06 <gdelhumeau> I can't close...  
18:06 <tmortagne> ok doing it then  
18:06 <gdelhumeau> I have still the issue with jira :(  
18:11 <gdelhumeau> thx  
18:18 <xwikinewb> has joined #xwiki  
18:20 <xwikinewb> Hi, I'm new to Xwiki and try to get a floating text box. If I enter "{{velocity}}#floatingbox("Test-text"){{/velocity}}" as xwiki code, the result ends up being html code.  
18:20 <xwikinewb> Am I missing some step?  
18:21 <ClemensR> yes, also add {{html}} ... {{/html}}  around the complete thing  
18:22 <ClemensR> by default output generated by the velocity gets interpreted as wiki syntax (and html escaped in the fitrst place)  
18:24 <xwikinewb> Ah, it worked with a minor change. I used them in the order "{{velocity}}{{html}}...{{/html}}{{/velocity}}"  
18:24 <tmortagne> xwikinewb: you can also use {{box cssClass="floatinginfobox" title="\*\*Contents\*\*"}}Test-text{{/box}} instead of mixing velocity and html  
18:25 <tmortagne> #floatingbox is a bit old and written when the default syntax was a mix of velocity and html by default  
18:25 <xwikinewb> how would I go about to find out about those useful macros? :)  
18:26 <tmortagne> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Box+Macro for the box macro and the "floatinginfobox" is simple the same css class used by #floatingbox  
18:26 <xwikinewb> ok. Guess I ended up on an old page when searching xwiki.org pages  
18:26 <tmortagne> in general you have most macros in http://extensions.xwiki.org  
18:27 <tmortagne> there is old stuff in http://extensions.xwiki.org too  
18:27 <tmortagne> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Floating+Box+Macro would probably require a comment explaining the new way  
18:29 <xwikinewb> I'll test it out tomorrow and see if I can add a good comment.
